meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes money.
meanings.sent1: My aunt is a moneymaker because she owns a successful bakery.
meanings.sent2: Investing in stocks can be a moneymaker if done wisely.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel became a moneymaker by selling acorns to other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her online store was a moneymaker, bringing in profits every month.
meanings.sent5: The old car turned out to be a surprising moneymaker when it was sold for a high price.

meanings.definition: Something that is profitable or lucrative.
meanings.sent1: The lemonade stand was a moneymaker for the kids during the hot summer.
meanings.sent2: Real estate can be a moneymaker if you invest in the right properties.
meanings.sent3: The magic trick was a moneymaker at the school talent show, earning the performer a lot of coins.
meanings.sent4: Her idea for a new app turned out to be a moneymaker, attracting many users.
meanings.sent5: The small business became a moneymaker after introducing a popular product to the market.
